relation: Element
Track Content Access Only
Do Not Populate Access Log Columns
Simplify User Agent String
Maximum Days to Retain Data
Do Not Archive Expired Data
Enter Maximum URL Length
Enter Maximum Proxy Name Length
Post Reduction Executable
Web Beacon ID List
Update
Reset
Revert To Install Settings
Description
If selected, specifies to track content access only. By default, the checkbox is selected.
Specifies the access log columns to not populate.
If selected, simplifies the user agent string. By default, the checkbox is selected.
Specifies the maximum number of days that data is retained. The default setting is 60.
If selected, specifies to not archive expired data. By default, the checkbox is selected.
Enter the maximum number of characters for the length of URLs. The default setting is 3000.
Enter the maximum number of characters for the length of a proxy name. The default setting is 50.
Specifies a post-reduction executable. There is no default.
Specifies a list of web beacon IDs.
Updates the component configuration with the modified field settings.
Returns modified field settings to their previous values.
Changes component configuration field settings to their install setting values.

textBeforeTable: You must restart the Content Server instance after making any component configuration change. Note: Choose Administration then Configuration for instance. Click Enabled Component Details, then click Configure next to the ContentTracker component name. If the component is not enabled, click Disabled Component Details to find the component to configure. Open the Admin Server Page, select Component Manager, click advanced component manager, select ContentTracker from the Update Component Configuration list, then click Update. There are two ways to access the Update Component Configuration screen: This screen is used to modify configuration settings for the Content Tracker component. A.3.7.3 Content Tracker Update Component Configuration Screen Changes component configuration field settings to their install setting values. Revert To Install Settings Returns modified field settings to their previous values. Reset Updates the component configuration with the modified field settings. Update
textAfterTable: A.3.7.4 Content Tracker Reports Update Component Configuration Screen This screen is used to modify configuration settings for the Content Tracker Reports component. There are two ways to access the Update Component Configuration screen: Open the Admin Server Page, select Component Manager, click advanced component manager, select ContentTrackerReports from the Update Component Configuration list, then click Update. Choose Administration then Configuration for instance. Click Enabled Component Details, then click Configure next to the ContentTrackerReports component name. If the component is not enabled, click Disabled Component Details to find the component to configure. Note: You must restart the Content Server instance after making any component configuration change. Element Description Enable Security Checks on Queries If selected, enables security checks on Content Tracker Report queries. By default, the checkbox is not selected.
